content.question: Rocket A has positive velocity v(t) after being launched upward from an initial height of 0 feet at time t = 0 seconds. The velocity of the rocket is recorded for selected values of t over the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>80</mn> </mrow> <annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaGimaiabgs MiJkaadshacqGHKjYOcaaI4aGaaGimaaaa@3C8F@</annotation> </semantics> </math> seconds, as show in the table above. (a) Find the average acceleration of rocket A over the time interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>80</mn> </mrow> <annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaGimaiabgs MiJkaadshacqGHKjYOcaaI4aGaaGimaaaa@3C8F@</annotation> </semantics> </math> seconds. Indicate units of measure.

frqParts.text: Rocket A has positive velocity v(t) after being launched upward from an initial height of 0 feet at time t = 0 seconds. The velocity of the rocket is recorded for selected values of t over the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>80</mn> </mrow> <annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaGimaiabgs MiJkaadshacqGHKjYOcaaI4aGaaGimaaaa@3C8F@</annotation> </semantics> </math> seconds, as show in the table above. (a) Find the average acceleration of rocket A over the time interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>80</mn> </mrow> <annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaGimaiabgs MiJkaadshacqGHKjYOcaaI4aGaaGimaaaa@3C8F@</annotation> </semantics> </math> seconds. Indicate units of measure.

(b) Using correct units, explain the meaning of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>70</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <mrow> <mi>v</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaa8qmaeaaca WG2bWaaeWaaeaacaWG0baacaGLOaGaayzkaaaaleaacaaIXaGaaGim aaqaaiaaiEdacaaIWaaaniabgUIiYdGccaWGKbGaamiDaaaa@4078@</annotation> </semantics> </math> in terms of the rockets flight. Use a midpoint Riemann sum with 3 subintervals of equal length to approximate <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>70</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <mrow> <mi>v</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaa8qmaeaaca WG2bWaaeWaaeaacaWG0baacaGLOaGaayzkaaaaleaacaaIXaGaaGim aaqaaiaaiEdacaaIWaaaniabgUIiYdGccaWGKbGaamiDaaaa@4078@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

(c) Rocket B is launched upward with an acceleration of a(t) = <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>3</mn> <mrow> <msqrt> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaaSaaaeaaca aIZaaabaWaaOaaaeaacaWG0bGaey4kaSIaaGymaaWcbeaaaaaaaa@3974@</annotation> </semantics> </math> feet per second per second. At time t = 0 seconds, the initial height of the rocket is 0 feet, and the initial velocity is 2 feet per second. Which of the two rockets is traveling faster at time t = 80 seconds? Explain your answer.

topic.text: 2.3: Estimating Derivatives of a Function at a Point

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
